content.body: As far as syntax bikeshedding outside of the formal meeting goes, probably don't wanna forget it impacts `import()` too?
content.formatted_body: As far as syntax bikeshedding outside of the formal meeting goes, probably don't wanna forget it impacts import() too?

content.body: And interesting point on CSS, I didn't realize those would forbid further imports. Not sure if that's enough as they also take URLs, but maybe. (It would have been so nice if import specifiers were just URLs. We could have made `js:specifier` work. Oh well.)
content.formatted_body: And interesting point on CSS, I didn't realize those would forbid further imports. Not sure if that's enough as they also take URLs, but maybe. (It would have been so nice if import specifiers were just URLs. We could have made js:specifier work. Oh well.)

content.body:
> <@annevk:matrix.org> As far as syntax bikeshedding outside of the formal meeting goes, probably don't wanna forget it impacts `import()` too?

Yes, we would need to make the decision of whether this puts all attributes at the top level, or whether they stay in a `with` property
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @annevk:matrix.org
As far as syntax bikeshedding outside of the formal meeting goes, probably don't wanna forget it impacts import() too?
Yes, we would need to make the decision of whether this puts all attributes at the top level, or whether they stay in a with property

content.body:
> <@annevk:matrix.org> And interesting point on CSS, I didn't realize those would forbid further imports. Not sure if that's enough as they also take URLs, but maybe. (It would have been so nice if import specifiers were just URLs. We could have made `js:specifier` work. Oh well.)

I think it is a straightforward solution to say, within CSS there is a default type (and they would need to add some syntax if they wanted to import JS, whatever that means)

I think it is a straightforward solution to say, within CSS there is a default type (and they would need to add some syntax if they wanted to import JS, whatever that means)
